messages.message: @Ted @Aaron Vontell @Loc - Looks like we started using nltk in some new services recently? Do you guys know which ones exactly. So far I’ve caught api-server-apps. Anything else?

@Jonathan Shih Got another error in apps-server:
```
ImportError: No module named sklearn.feature_extraction.text
```
haha it’s all good now. we demoed it on my computer already
haha — that is not what we meant :slightly_smiling_face: we cannot even deploy right now because of that :slightly_smiling_face:
do you know how to fix it?

@Ted @Loc - Andddd another one in emerson-service:
```
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'google'
```
oh LOL sorry uh
is that my code?
don’t know :slightly_smiling_face: it happens in classifier
hmm i don’t know where it’s importing sklearn
did something change in shared-utils/py-utils/model-utils/src/py/instabase/model_utils/classifier_naive.py
seems to be the only place that imports sklearn.feature_extractor.text

oh fascinating. haha guess it got pulled in. it should just be app-tasks that needs it
is this apps-server that’s complaining?
oh i think it's because we added model-utils somewehere recently
which service?
yes, apps-server
@Jonathan Shih, @lydia - Can one of you fix this depedency?
i think this might be on me. can we include sklearn in apps-server?
yes, but do we need to?
let me dig into it a little more… don’t think it was necessary for the stuff i was working on. @lydia did you guys need it for anything?
do you think it's related to us added model-utils as a dependency in image-tasks?
that was changed recently
oh nvm, that was probalby not changed recently cause there are a ton of imports from model-utils
I’m guessing that we need all of these deps on the server side (*tasks, ocr* etc.), but not sure if it required on the client side (webserver/*)
@Ted @Aaron Vontell @Loc - More deps. Looks like api-server-apps is now importing nltk and panads. Are these both required?
I can remove the dependency of apps-server
i think it's coming from us adding model-utils to docops-lib
Possible. I got to the next error. Looks like api-server-apps also has a new dep on sklearn.
jk not docops-lib ^^. @lydia is doing binary search on deps to figure out what is causing apps-server to import model-utils
